sen.j: 朽木 玄綱（くつき とうつな）は、丹波国福知山藩の第5代藩主。
sen.e: Totsuna KUTSUKI is the fifth lord of Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Totsuna KUTSUKI is the fifth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
Totsuna KUTSUKI is the fifth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain in Tanba Province.
The sixth head of the Kutsuki family in Fukuchiyama Domain.
The sixth head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.
The sixth head of the Kutsuki family in the Fukuchiyama Domain.

sen.j: 宝永6年（1709年）9月11日、美濃国岩村藩の第3代藩主・松平乗紀の五男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born on October 13, 1709, as the fifth son of Noritada MATSUDAIRA, the third load of Iwamura Domain in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: （表記の変更） 「松平乗紀」は「まつだいらのりただ」：http://kotobank.jp/word/%E6%9D%BE%E5%B9%B3%E4%B9%97%E7%B4%80
sen.e: He was born on October 13, 1709, as the fifth son of Noritada MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the Iwamura Domain in Mino Province.
sen.cmt: lordのスペルミス修正、the Iwamura Domainとしました。
sen.e: He was born on October 13, 1709, as the fifth son of Noritada MATSUDAIRA, the third lord of the Iwamura Domain in Mino Province.

sen.j: 享保12年（1727年）、福知山藩の第4代藩主・朽木稙治の養子となる。
sen.e: In 1727 he became an adopted child of Taneharu KUTSUKI, the forth lord of Fukuchiyama Domain.
In 1727 he became an adopted child of Taneharu KUTSUKI, the fourth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain.
sen.cmt: fourthのスペルミス修正、the Fukuchiyama Domainとしました。
sen.e: In 1727 he became an adopted child of Taneharu KUTSUKI, the fourth lord of the Fukuchiyama Domain.

sen.j: 享保13年（1728年）11月23日、稙治が隠居したため、家督を継いで第5代藩主となる。
sen.e: On December 23, 1728, as Taneharu retired, he became the fifth lord succeeding to the family estate.
On December 23, 1728, as Taneharu retired, he became the fifth lord succeeding to the family estate.
On December 23, 1728, as Taneharu retired, he became the fifth lord succeeding to the family estate.

sen.j: 藩政では享保17年（1732年）、享保の大飢饉が原因で、享保19年（1734年）に享保の強訴と呼ばれる騒動が起こり、藩内は混乱した。
sen.e: As for administration of the domain, due to the Great Famine of Kyoho of 1732, a riot called the Direct Petition of Kyoho occurred in 1734, which lcaused confusion in the domain.
sen.cmt: 日本語の意味がとりにくいのですが、「1732年の享保の大飢饉が原因で」と解釈しました。
sen.e: As for administration of the domain, due to the Great Famine of Kyoho of 1732, a riot called the Direct Petition of Kyoho occurred in 1734, which lcaused confusion in the Domain.
As for administration of the domain, due to the Great Famine of Kyoho of 1732, a riot called the Direct Petition of Kyoho occurred in 1734, which lcaused confusion in the Domain.

sen.j: このため、米価高騰により、自らの生活を最低にして出費を抑えている。
sen.e: This led to a rise of rice price and forced him to live on a minimum standard of living to suppress his expenses.
This led to a rise of rice price and forced him to live on a minimum standard of living to suppress his expenses.
This led to a rise of rice price and forced him to live on a minimum standard of living to suppress his expenses.

sen.j: また、明智光秀御霊法会を許可している（御霊祭りの開始）。
sen.e: And he gave permission for a religious service for the spirit of late Hidemitsu AKECHI (beginning of Goryo-sai Festival which is festivals of Kamigoryo-jinja Shrine and of Shimogoryo-jinja Shrine).
And he gave permission for a religious service for the spirit of late Hidemitsu AKECHI (beginning of Goryo-sai Festival - festivals of Kamigoryo-jinja Shrine and of Shimogoryo-jinja Shrine).
And he gave permission for a religious service for the spirit of late Hidemitsu AKECHI (beginning of Goryo-sai Festival - festivals of Kamigoryo-jinja Shrine and of Shimogoryo-jinja Shrine).

sen.j: さらに後継者問題でも、稙治の養子だった朽木綱貞を擁立する一派と自らの子を擁立したい玄綱が対立し、もともと大給松平家から養子として入った玄綱には後ろ盾が無く、綱貞を養子に迎えている。
sen.e: Furthermore, when it comes to a matter of his successor, a party who supported Tsunasada KUTSUKI, Taneharu's adopted son, confronted Totsuna who wanted to support his own son, but Totsuna, as originally adopted from the Ogyu Matsudaira family, had no supportes and accepted to adopt Tsunasada.

Furthermore, when it comes to a matter of his successor, a party who supported Tsunasada KUTSUKI, Taneharu's adopted son, confronted Totsuna who wanted to support his own son, but Totsuna, as originally adopted from the Ogyu Matsudaira family, had no supportes and accepted to adopt Tsunasada.
sen.cmt: Taneharu’sのアポストロフィーを半角に修正
sen.e: Furthermore, when it comes to a matter of his successor, a party who supported Tsunasada KUTSUKI, Taneharu's adopted son, confronted Totsuna who wanted to support his own son, but Totsuna, as originally adopted from the Ogyu Matsudaira family, had no supportes and accepted to adopt Tsunasada.

sen.j: このように混乱続きの藩政で、玄綱の功績には文武の発展がある。
sen.e: Although these troubles occurred one after another during his administration of the domain, Totsuna's achievements include development of literary and military arts.
Although these troubles occurred one after another during his administration of the domain, Totsuna's achievements include development of literary and military arts.
sen.cmt: Totsuna’s のアポストロフィーを半角に修正
sen.e: Although these troubles occurred one after another during his administration of the domain, Totsuna's achievements include development of literary and military arts.

sen.j: 宝暦8年（1758年）には寺社奉行に任じられた。
sen.e: In 1758 he was appointed to jisha bugyo (a magistrate of temples and shrines).
In 1758 he was appointed to jisha bugyo (a magistrate of temples and shrines).
In 1758 he was appointed to jisha bugyo (a magistrate of temples and shrines).
He died on October 18, 1770.
He died on October 18, 1770.
He died on October 18, 1770.
He died at the age of 62.
He died at the age of 62.
He died at the age of 62.

sen.j: 跡を養子の綱貞が継いだ。
sen.e: His adopted son Tomosada succeeded him as the head of the family.
His adopted son Tomosada succeeded him as the head of the family.
His adopted son Tomosada succeeded him as the head of the family.
